metadata.purpose: AI research agent extraction template with existing database references

source_documents.notes: Add your source document details here

database_references.description: Existing data in the NukeWorks database to help match and link extracted information

existing_companies.notes:
Large U.S. utility (Midwest/Texas). In 2023 AEP began evaluating SMRs to replace retiring coal by 2030s. Subsidiary SWEPCO’s 2023 IRP includes a ~SMR resource post-2030. AEP has sought federal grants to study SMR siting at coal sites:contentReference[oaicite:59]{index=59}:contentReference[oaicite:60]{index=60}. No specific vendor publicly chosen yet.

Sources:
https://content.govdelivery.com/attachments/OHPR/2023/03/27/file_attachments/2440800/OPSB%20SMR%20presentation.pdf
https://energy.virginia.gov/renewable-energy/documents/FINAL%20LENOWISCO%20SMR%20Feasibility%20Study%20-%20DEI%2020230520%20.pdf#:~:text=AEP's%20interest%20in%20the%20nuclear%20space%20is%20currently%20focused%20on%20larger%20SMRs.%20(>300%20MW)

U.S. utility (Virginia, SC, etc.) operating 4 nuclear units. Studying SMRs to meet Virginia’s growing data center load. In Oct 2024, Dominion and AWS (Amazon) agreed to explore a ~300 MW SMR at North Anna by 2032:contentReference[oaicite:57]{index=57}. Dominion is also extending existing reactors for 20 more years and involved in national SMR discussions (e.g., joined SCOUT SMR utility group).

Sources:
https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/sustainability/amazon-nuclear-small-modular-reactor-net-carbon-zero#:~:text=In%20Virginia%2C%20we%E2%80%99ve%20signed%20an%20agreement%20with%20utility%20company%20Dominion%20Energy%20to%20explore%20the%20development%20of%20an%20SMR%20project%20near%20Dominion%E2%80%99s%20existing%20North%20Anna%20nuclear%20power%20station.%20This%20will%20bring%20at%20least%20300%20megawatts%20of%20power
https://www.richmond.com/news/state-regional/government-politics/virginia-small-nuclear-reactors-youngkin-north-anna/article_a1b4454c-d43e-11ed-8ef3-5fdf3b2ccf3e.html

Stealth nuclear development company (Greer, SC) founded 2022. Contracted by Google in 2024 to identify and prepare at least three U.S. sites for ~600 MW advanced nuclear installations, with Google as an option PPA off-taker:contentReference[oaicite:78]{index=78}. Goal is to bring 10 GW of new nuclear online by 2035:contentReference[oaicite:79]{index=79}. Backed by Breakwater North and Energy Impact Partners. Working closely with Kairos Power (Google’s other nuclear partner) on siting and deployment strategies.

Sources:
https://trellis.net/article/amazon-google-meta-and-microsoft-go-nuclear/#:~:text=Elementl%20Power...contracted%20by%20Google%20to%20prepare%20at%20least%20three%20sites%20...%20Each%20installation%20would%20have%20a%20generation%20capacity%20of%20at%20least%20600%20megawatts :contentReference[oaicite:80]{index=80}
https://www.energy.gov/gain/downloads/elementl-power-llc

Washington State joint operating agency (owns Columbia Generating Station). Partnered via JDA with X-energy to develop up to twelve Xe-100 reactors (first unit by 2030) at a site near the Columbia plant:contentReference[oaicite:42]{index=42}:contentReference[oaicite:43]{index=43}. Also received Amazon support for four initial units (320 MW) with option up to 960 MW:contentReference[oaicite:44]{index=44}.

Sources:
https://x-energy.com/media/news-releases/energy-northwest-x-energy-joint-development-agreement-xe-100#:~:text=up%20to%2012%20Xe%2D100%20advanced%20small%20modular%20reactors%20in%20central%20Washington%20capable%20of%20generating%20up%20to%20a%20total%20of%20960%20megawatts
https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/sustainability/amazon-nuclear-small-modular-reactor-net-carbon-zero#:~:text=In%20Washington%2C%20our%20agreement%20with%20Energy%20Northwest%20...%20will%20enable%20the%20development%20of%20four%20advanced%20SMRs.

Google (Alphabet) aims for 24/7 carbon-free energy by 2030 and views advanced nuclear as pivotal. In 2023 it made the first-ever corporate PPA for new nuclear: partnering with Kairos Power to offtake up to 50 MW from the Hermes 2 demonstration in Tennessee by 2030:contentReference[oaicite:97]{index=97}. Google also signed with Kairos to enable 500 MW of fleet deployment for its future needs:contentReference[oaicite:98]{index=98}. Additionally, Google is contracting Elementl Power to prep several U.S. sites for ~600 MW nuclear plants that Google may buy power from:contentReference[oaicite:99]{index=99}. It was a signatory of the 2025 "Triple Nuclear Capacity by 2050" pledge:contentReference[oaicite:100]{index=100} and is generally deeply involved in SMR development consortia.

Sources:
https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Google,-Kairos-Power,-TVA-announce-collaboration
https://trellis.net/article/amazon-google-meta-and-microsoft-go-nuclear

extraction_instructions.matching_strategy: When extracting information from PDFs, use the database_references section above to identify and link existing records. This helps ensure data consistency and proper relationship mapping.

company_matching.instructions: If you find a company name in the PDF, check the existing_companies list. If there's a match (exact or close match), use that company_id instead of creating a new entry.
examples: If PDF mentions a company in the list → Link to that company_id
If PDF mentions a new company not in list → Mark as new_company and provide company details

internal_personnel_matching.instructions: When you encounter MPR employee names in PDFs, check existing_internal_personnel. Match by name, title, or email if found.
examples: If PDF mentions an employee in the list → Use that personnel_id
If you find an MPR employee not in the list → Mark as new_internal_personnel

external_personnel_matching.instructions: Match external contacts from PDFs against existing_external_personnel by name, company, and title.
examples: If PDF mentions a contact in the list → Use that personnel_id
If you find a new external contact → Mark as new_external_personnel with full details

external_client.db_match_reason: NEW - To be filled by AI agent from PDF research
external_client.notes: Add client information extracted from PDF

internal_contacts.db_match_reason: To be filled by AI agent - check against database_references

external_personnel.db_match_reason: To be filled by AI agent - check against database_references

client_near_term_focus_areas: Add client near-term focus areas from PDF
mpr_work_targets_goals: Add MPR work targets/goals from PDF
client_strategic_objectives_priorities: Add client strategic objectives from PDF
fields.general_discussion: Add general discussion notes from PDF

data_quality_notes.general: Prioritize accuracy over completeness. Leave fields null/empty if information cannot be found or verified in source documents.
data_quality_notes.matching_confidence: Always include db_match_confidence and db_match_reason fields when linking to existing database records using the database_references section above.
data_quality_notes.new_records: For any external company, internal employee, or external contact NOT found in database_references, clearly mark as 'new' and provide all details extracted from the PDF.
data_quality_notes.conflicts: If you find conflicting information (e.g., different phone number for same contact), include a note explaining the discrepancy and your confidence level.
